The landscaping is lovely, rooms are nice with comfortable bed and linens however there was a very offensive odor in the room when we first checked it. We had to open the windows even after an air freshener was used. The pool view rooms are stunning and you get to appreciate nature in its element. The food was good, fair selection and all in all, it was a nice stay.

I travel to Lagos frequently and wanted a hotel that is quiet and reserved on my recent trip. I found this hotel suited my requirements. I was impressed by its ambiance and found the staff members warm and friendly.  I will definatly used this hotel again in the near future.

When working abroad it is not always easy as one's day tends to be office to hotel to office.   I can truly say that the staff at the Hotel Bon Voyage in Lagos made it seem like I was going home, and not to a hotel.   The staff are the most friendly of any place I have visited and they certainly make the challenges of working in Lagos a pleasure.  The food is great, the pool is so beautiful with the beach back drop.   I would not stay anywhere other than here while working in Lagos.   A cold Star Beer at the end of a day outside by the pool can not be beat!

I would personally like to thank the management and staff at the Hotel Bon Voyage for making my stay so pleasant and comfortable.  The rooms were Clean Tidy and the service was flawless.  The staff ensured that we were taken care of professionally from the moment we arrived. Would like to thank Especially Mr. Prakash and Ms.Yemisi for their Hospitality. I would highly recommend this hotel in Lagos and will be sure that other also will enjoy the stay.  Cheers Simon

Review Title: WOW what a wonderful experience in Lagos
Review Text: I stayed in this hotel for a lovely weekend in was bit of a romantic weekend and I was quite lucky because there was an event which was called "SALLAH SPECIAL" for the bank holidays. WOW was this a great experience !!!, it was so chilled, well organised and the food was literally amazing, It was so well organised especially within the hustle and bustle of Lagos city. My only mistake was I didn't use this opportunity to propose to my girlfriend cos that was all that was missing, I would definitely be visiting this hotel in the very near future .... event or no event cos its definitely worth your money and I will recommend it to anybody.

Probably best value for money in Lagos. New restaurant manager Lena has made a huge difference to the quality of the food and restaurant. internet service still needs improvement but most of the time is Ok.  Location is as good if not better than sheraton four points. Some construction noise from adjacent building site but for Lagos this hotel can be rated as QUIET. Service is with a smile even if not fast but still much better than most of the competition in Lagos.

Review Title: An average stay at an upmarket hotel
Review Text: I stayed in this hotel for good 15 days , rooms were pretty neat and with basic amenities . Service was at acceptable levels , However nothing great about the service . There were house keeping issues like water overflowed from floor above into my room because of which i had to change my room which was done pretty quickly . Morning breakfast was with good spread however vegetarians like me will have to be contempt with whatever fruits and breads available , mashed potatoes all time favorite for the chef here .  Fairly safe place to stay with good security especially when u r travelling to Nigeria , view from the pool side is good however sea water is clogged up with garbage .  I would rate it as 3 out of 5 considering money i am paying for this stay .   regards  pratik gupta .

The staff all made sure that my team and I were taken care of professionally from the moment we arrived. I would highly recommend this hotel and will be sure to stay again every time I visit Lagos.

Lagos is a crazy city, and to have a quiet and calm hotel in a bustling city and even the busy business district of Victoria Island is really impressive, its in a quiet location there.  They need to improve on their towels and some of the finishing in the hotel some walls are fading, or peeling off.the food is good and the hotel staff seem quite friendly.  They can improve on this.

I stayed in Hotel Bon Voyage,V.I with my fiance and i must say it was a pleasant experience.Though the room wasn't very spacious,it was very clean and the bathroom was spotless & boasted of all the usual amenities.Our room had a separate sitting area and mini bar,and was quite cosy and attractive.Hotel staff were friendly and polite. What made us fall in love with Bon Voyage was the poolside bar;there was literally just a fence separating the property from the ocean,and it was fantastic sitting and sipping drinks under the umbrella while enjoying the smell and sound of the ocean!We used to go sit out there in the evenings;nibbling the hotel's delicious snacks with our drinks and watching the ships,and the occasional fisherman paddling by in a canoe;If you go there try the 'bon

this is a good size boutique hotel. Rooms are of good size and well equipped. Modern African style. Restaurant is good. The bar an pool area is by the water and its as good a view as you can get in Lagos. If you want a quiet place to stay near the busy Tony Anegbode Street, this is for you.

The hotel is very good, neat, and beautiful environment. The food is great too with warm, friendly staff. The pool overlooks a lake and makes for nice scenery. I stayed there with family and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Going back there this week with hubby and so looking forward to it. Given the very pricey hotels in Lagos, this one is a very good treat!

Have just completed 2 week stay on business, felt longer!. Cramped room - mini bar fridge in front of the wardrobe. Room had faulty safe, no toilet seat, faulty electric points, and erratic wifi - had to ask for network cable to be installed. Apparently, no other rooms available.Friendly staff, but no eye for detail - chipped glasses, frayed towels. Restaurant food was good although service poor, often no glasses for breakfast orange juice, and cutlery missing on tables. Regular power cuts cannot be helped, but AC 'pinged' loudly when power restored so disturbed sleep.  As a regular traveller among the poorest quality hotels I have stayed in. Don't usually post reviews but this experience was particularly disappointing.

It was such a treat to be here. A lovely property with an exceptional view of the seaside pool & a bar; which is quite reasonable. The rooms are spacious with all basic amenities.   The highlight of this place is the General Manger -Mr.Prakash,who is extremely helpful. If you are staying here, you must take his advice on the city and even your business plans. I stayed at this hotel in November 2012. A nice, decent place with an ocean view, and not too expensive. The staff are very friendly, competent and helpful. Don't expect fast room service, though. The pool bar is facing the ocean, and frequently features quality DJs and live music.

Amazing is the word, friendly staff, amazing chefs good food, decent pricing. It may not be a burj al Arab but I love it here. The toilet pieces are great. Love the location too. And if you in large group you may get discount. Love the place

Review Title: Very nice, reasonably priced (by Lagos standards)
Review Text: This is a nice hotel, quite new and well maintained. Rooms are a bit small, but bed is big and comfortable. Internet connection is good (again, this is Nigeria...) and for Israeli guests, the Israeli Channel is free. Friendly staff, an OK breakfast. Didn't use the pool but it looked nice, though small.

Review Title: Nice, but a little bit expensive
Review Text: Stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago. Clean rooms, okay service and great food.  My only query was that it was a bit on the expensive side. Nonetheless, I would recommend this hotel for those who are willing to part with their money and want a little bit of quiet and peace in a very busy city.

I stayed for 6 nights and had to endure with a sqeaking water heater noise the whole stay, I informed the front desk but, they didnt fix the problem. I will not be going back. I spent $1500.00 US Dollars on this!

I've been to many hotels in Lagos,this seems to be the best for now I've been to.its one of a kind with good service like efficient check in,good restaurant with palatable food,serene and a very clean environment.the rooms are better with new furnitures,nice duvets,rushing shower with a nice bath tub with a very big and clean towel,shampoo,shower bath and a bathroom slipps.a very quiet environment with nice treated pool with a cool music to please your soul in the evening by the pool side.their shortcomings-filthy,dirty bootles and dirts from the lagoon that I sjust beside the pool side and no internet!.I'll like to come here again and again and I also recommend this place to all kind of people for relaxation at its peak!

Lagos hotels are very expensive ones and this one has pretty decent price for what it gives. Rooms are fine with all basics needed and are new. Check-in is very fast and reservation made by hotels.com was there as expected. i had no time to use the pool or the gym but they are there.  Location is pretty poor and you wouldn't go by yourself there - only with a driver who knows this place. Hotel is surrounded by electric fence for security purposes. the view from the pool is pretty shocking with huge amount of old plastic bottles in the Kuramo lake, hotel sits nearby.

Review Title: Quality Rooms and Service with a tranquil environment
Review Text: Having stayed at other Hotels in Lagos, I must admit Bon Voyage is impressive. The staff are friendly, the rooms are spacious with authentic decor. For me , its peaceful ambience coupled with its proximity to banks, businesses, cinema and the beach in Victoria Island was its USP. Worth every penny!

By normal major capital standards this place is awful, by  Lagos standards it's nearly OK. Mattress was very hard until it was turned over, swimming pool is surrounded by barbed wire and you just would not want to spend any time relaxing by the pool , the place is half built and is in the middle of a major building area. Rooms are clean but once you look closley the finish is very poor and not really of aceptable standard. The food was very poor, the only hotel I've stayed at anywhere in the world where the bar had no coke.
